artist: George Washington Maher Gorham Manufacturing Company Spaulding & Company, Chicago, Illinois
creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton in honor of Russell A. Plimpton
description: designed for Rockledge, the E. L. King House, Homer, MN (demolished 1987)
text: Too much of a good thing' Maher reproduced the tiger lilies on this custom-made silver service throughout the house he designed for Ernest and Grace King, including on the nearby bronze urn and armchair. He took the “unified design” philosophy to extremes, believing that repeated motifs would harmonize a home and its occupants. In reality, the Kings were overwhelmed by the repetition. But they felt compelled to accept it, even at a high cost: Today’s equivalent of what they paid for the coffee and tea service alone could buy a very nice family car today.
title: Hot water kettle and stand from the coffee and tea service for Rockledge
